ast.name: k12 introcs turtle2
ast.comment: Draw incredible drawings with the turtle!

body.text: This is week 2 of the [K-12 intro cs](/k12introcs) curriculum.
Learn drawing methods using programming logic
* login with your Microsoft or Facebook or Google account

Let's try to draw a square with turtle. Turtle does not know about squares but it knows how to turn and move forward. So, to draw a square, we need to create a sequence of **forward moves** and **left turns**.
Let's start by running the script to see what it does.
* run the game by tapping the `[code->]` play button and see what happens
Yay! The turtle is moving up then turning left.
* press the `[â†]` button on the upper left to go back to the editor.
Turtle is ready to move forward. Let's add a line of code to tell Turtle to move 200 steps **forward**.
On the phone or in portrait mode, you will have to tap on the `[script]` button in the upper right to pop up the script explorer.
* tap on the last line of code to select it
* tap on the bottom `[+]` button below the code to add a new line
This is how the code looks like in your editor.
* tap on `[forward]`. If this button is not visible, cycle through more options using the blue `[>>]` button.
This is how the code looks like in your editor.
* use the number pad to change `0` to `200`. You might have to tap on `[123]` to pop up the number pad.
* tap anywhere in the white area to hide the keyboard.
* tap anywhere in the white area to dismiss the keyboard
* run your game and see what happens
The next step is to turn again to the left.
* tap on the last line of code to select it
* tap on the `[libs->turtle]` in the lower right keyboard.
* tap on `[left turn]`. If this button is not visible, cycle through more options using the blue `[>>]` button.
* use the number pad in the lower right to change `0` to `90`
* run your game and see what happens
* add the code to move forward `200` steps
* run your game and see what happens
* add the code to turn left '`90` degrees and move forward `200` steps another time
* and one more left turn so that turtle finishes exactly where it started
* run your game and see what happens
Yay! The turtle is drawing a square!
* add a new line at the beginning (tap on the first line of code and tap the `[+]` on top). change the thickness of the pen to  `10`. run your game to see what happens
Watch a quick tutorial on how to write your name with turtle
Don't forget to [publish](/publishing) your script so that others can try it out!
Activity is an in-class assignment that can be done in a single hour of class. Create a script that uses turtle to draw your first name or nickname, or your favorite artist name.
Turtle Coodinate Assignment: Figure a way to move your turtle to design these images.  1 point / drawing
Turtle Name: Create a piece of art that uses turtle to draw your first name or nickname, or your favorite artist name. 20 Points
* Draw your design on paper (10 points)
* At least 3 letters drawn on screen. Any alphabet accepted. (20 points)
